publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-217 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Nuclear Weapons—That the Parliament, conscious of the assurances from the Ministry of Defence about the safety of the military nuclear facilities at Faslane and Loch Goil, notes that the three women accused of illegally entering the military base there gained easy entry; notes the universal acceptance of the inherent danger to human life posed by nuclear material; calls upon the Scottish Executive to initiate an immediate investigation into the threat to the health and safety of the Scottish population and the environment represented by the nuclear base, and requests Her Majesty’s Government to suspend all military activities there. Supported by: Alex Neil*, Christine Grahame*, Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-217 Nuclear Weapons (lodged on 25 October 1999) Ms Sandra White*, Alasdair Morgan*, Kay Ullrich*
S1M-217 Nuclear Weapons (lodged on 25 October 1999) Andrew Wilson*, Irene McGugan*, Dennis Canavan*, Michael Russell*, Brian Adam*, Fiona Hyslop*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-217 Nuclear Weapons (lodged on 25 October 1999) Linda Fabiani*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Michael Matheson*

S1M-217 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Nuclear Weapons—That the Parliament, conscious of the assurances from the Ministry of Defence about the safety of the military nuclear facilities at Faslane and Loch Goil, notes that the three women accused of illegally entering the military base there gained easy entry; notes the universal acceptance of the inherent danger to human life posed by nuclear material; calls upon the Scottish Executive to initiate an immediate investigation into the threat to the health and safety of the Scottish population and the environment represented by the nuclear base, and requests Her Majesty’s Government to suspend all military activities there. Supported by: Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Ms Margo MacDonald, Ms Sandra White, Alasdair Morgan, Kay Ullrich, Andrew Wilson, Irene McGugan, Dennis Canavan, Michael Russell, Brian Adam, Fiona Hyslop, Dr Winnie Ewing, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*

Supported by: Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Ms Margo MacDonald, Ms Sandra White, Alasdair Morgan, Kay Ullrich, Andrew Wilson, Irene McGugan, Dennis Canavan, Michael Russell, Brian Adam, Fiona Hyslop, Dr Winnie Ewing, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mrs Margaret Ewing
S1M-217# Nuclear Weapons (lodged on 25 October 1999) Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-217# Nuclear Weapons (lodged on 25 October 1999) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-217# Nuclear Weapons (lodged on 25 October 1999) Bruce Crawford*

S1M-217# Dorothy-Grace Elder: Nuclear Weapons-That the Parliament conscious of the assurances from the Ministry of Defence about the safety of the military nuclear facilities at Faslane and Loch Goil, notes that the three women accused of illegally entering the military base there gained easy entry; notes the universal acceptance of the inherent danger to human life posed by nuclear material; calls upon the Scottish Executive to initiate an immediate investigation into the threat to the health and safety of the Scottish population and the environment represented by the nuclear base, and requests Her Majesty's Government to suspend all military activities there. Supported by: Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Ms Margo MacDonald, Ms Sandra White, Alasdair Morgan, Kay Ullrich, Andrew Wilson, Irene McGugan, Dennis Canavan, Michael Russell, Brian Adam, Fiona Hyslop, Dr Winnie Ewing, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tommy Sheridan, Bruce Crawford
